title: Some skins are so awsome they could have been a new Champ entirely.....
body:
Before you down vote.... just here me out.

For example, {{champion:18}} dragon trainer/pet skin could have been a new ADC all by itself. The concept of someone wielding a mini dragon as a gun would make for a great ADC. I feel like it is a great skin, but it would have more potential as a new champ.

Same with elemental Lux, Fabulous skin! Would have made for a great idea for new a mage. 

The idea could have been a mage that had too much power and could not fully control which element she used. So her passive would be that the mage would randomly switch elemental modes every x amount of seconds. There would only be like 3 element cause 9 is just way to much and each element would add a passive effect to her base spells. For example, fire element would add some AOE DOT. Ice element would add some slows and snares. Lightning would add some move speed buffs and electric charge bonus damage. 

The catch is she can't pick which element she would want.

Anyway... all in all, the point I want to make is that there are some skins that are so cool, they would have made great themes for new champs.

Yorick is awesome. He used to be, "Let's get tear, spam E, win lane". He also looked terrible, he looked like a jumping tumor. New Yorick has a defined role, cuter ghuols, and overall is just more interactive and fun to play. Kled has one of the best VO's in the game, and is a blast to play.

I still think new Yorick has some problems. Namely the fact that despite what Riot said about his new ultimate, it doesn't actually is good for splitpushing. This is because towers focus on the Maiden of Mist and it is killed by only a few tower shots. His ultimate honestly is only useful for 1x1 duels and is useless otherwise, especially because of its long cooldown. Also, Yorick's ghouls are one shotted late game, which is a problem especially with AoE abilities and ADCs with Runnan's Hurricane. If both of those problems were solved, Yorick would feel really good to play right now. At least he is way healthier than his old self.

Honestly? I was waiting an ''elementalist'' oriented champion. I don't like that rng-based passive you've developed but it's still kinda cool.
Riot has like every benter + lots of mages but not a wizard who can control elements and that sucks imo. Was expecting a champ based on elements, not a skin. Now we probably won't have the typical wizard who control elements because it would be Elementalist Lux 2.0, unless Riot puts effort on that champ. ( which is something they rarely do these days i.e: Kled, Camille, Bard and others).

No effort... Kled and Bard both introduced mechanics entirely unique to them. So did Ivern. What a brainless hater. They've been constantly trying to spice up gameplay with reworks, both on champions and the main map. So yeah. They definitely put effort in champs.
People complain that Riot adds too many unique mechanics to champions, people complain that champions have "boring, no-effort kits". Someone will complain no matter what you do.
Riot went for mages that control one element rather than one that controls multiple.

And I think they are right to do so. Champions have a pool of 4 skills. As long as you don't want the elementalists kit to change depending on the element (which would be broken because it offers way too many skills) that champ would have 1 skill for each element. That wouldn't feel like an elementalist at all, at least for me.

I hope with the Diver update they fix brawler champs like Dr.Mundo, Udyr, Skarner, and Shyvana because you can pretty much play them the same way and same style except with Skarners new crystal gimmick.

All these champions you listed are not part of the diver subclass, they are Juggernauts.

The major one is Spirit Guard Udyr. That should be the rework of Udyr. The movement animation and all that.

Tbh I'd argue it WAS the rework of Udyr. It's just that to rework Udyr it would cost money, and what better way to make money to pay for that than a new skin? It's like they said "Hello Udyr mains. If you pay us 35 dollars we will rework your champion into something amazing."

Personally i'm just happy with Riot's rework of {{champion:78}}, huge success in my book.
